# CGFont

**Class**

A set of character glyphs and layout information for drawing text.

## Declaration

```swift
class CGFont
```

## Overview

A glyph can represent a single character (such as ‘b’), more than one character (such as the “ﬁ” ligature), or a special character such as a space. Core Graphics retrieves the glyphs for the font from ATS (Apple Type Services) and paints the glyphs based on the relevant parameters of the current graphics state.

Core Graphics provides a limited, low-level interface for drawing text. For information on text-drawing functions, see [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGContext]. For full Unicode and text-layout support,  use the services provided by TextKit).

## Creating Font Objects

- **init(_:)**: Creates a font object from data supplied from a data provider.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a font object corresponding to the font specified by a PostScript or full name.

## Examining Font Metadata

- **fullName**: Returns the full name associated with a font object.

## Examining Font Metrics

- **ascent**: Returns the ascent of a font.
- **capHeight**: Returns the cap height of a font.
- **descent**: Returns the descent of a font.
- **fontBBox**: Returns the bounding box of a font.
- **italicAngle**: Returns the italic angle of a font.
- **leading**: Returns the leading of a font.
- **stemV**: Returns the thickness of the dominant vertical stems of glyphs in a font.
- **unitsPerEm**: Returns the number of glyph space units per em for the provided font.
- **xHeight**: Returns the x-height of a font.

## Working with PostScript Fonts

- **postScriptName**: Obtains the PostScript name of a font.
- **canCreatePostScriptSubset(_:)**: Determines whether Core Graphics can create a subset of the font in PostScript format.
- **createPostScriptSubset(subsetName:format:glyphs:count:encoding:)**: Creates a subset of the font in the specified PostScript format.
- **CGFontPostScriptFormat**: Possible formats for a PostScript font subset.
- **createPostScriptEncoding(encoding:)**: Creates a PostScript encoding of a font.

## Working with Font Tables

- **tableTags**: Returns an array of tags that correspond to the font tables for a font.
- **table(for:)**: Returns the font table that corresponds to the provided tag.
- **Font Table Index Values**: Possible values for an index into a font table.
- **Obsolete Font Table Index Values**: Deprecated values for an index into a font table.

## Working with Variations

- **copy(withVariations:)**: Creates a copy of a font using a variation specification dictionary.
- **variations**: Returns the variation specification dictionary for a font.
- **variationAxes**: Returns an array of the variation axis dictionaries for a font.
- **Font Variation Axis Keys**: Keys used for a font variation axis dictionary.

## Working with Glyphs

- **numberOfGlyphs**: Returns the number of glyphs in a font.
- **name(for:)**: Returns the glyph name of the specified glyph in the specified font.
- **getGlyphWithGlyphName(name:)**: Returns the glyph for the glyph name associated with the specified font object.
- **getGlyphBBoxes(glyphs:count:bboxes:)**: Get the bounding box of each glyph in an array.
- **getGlyphAdvances(glyphs:count:advances:)**: Gets the advance width of each glyph in the provided array.
- **CGGlyph**: An index into the internal glyph table of a font.
- **kCGGlyphMax**: The maximum allowed value of a [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGGlyph].
- **CGFontIndex**: An index into a font table.
- **kCGFontIndexMax**: The maximum allowed value of a [doc://com.apple.coregraphics/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGFontIndex].
- **kCGFontIndexInvalid**: An invalid font index (a value which never represents a valid glyph).

## Working with Core Foundation Types

- **typeID**: Returns the Core Foundation type identifier for Core Graphics fonts.

## Related Documentation

- **Quartz 2D Programming Guide**

## Colors and Fonts

- **CGColor**: A set of components that define a color, with a color space specifying how to interpret them.
- **CGColorConversionInfo**: An object that describes how to convert between color spaces for use by other system services.
- **CGColorSpace**: A profile that specifies how to interpret a color value for display.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
